name: File
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Storage.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, google-cloud.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as @google-cloud/storage.

The instructions below are here for reference, however, we will soon stop releasing updates to the bundled package.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var gcs = gcloud.storage();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var gcs = gcloud.storage({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: File
methods.description: A File object is created from your Bucket object using storage/bucket#file.

examples.code:
var myBucket = gcs.bucket('my-bucket');

var file = myBucket.file('my-file');

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete the file.

examples.code: file.delete(function(err, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Check if the file exists.

examples.code: file.exists(function(err, exists) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Get a file object and its metadata if it exists.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.description: Get the file's metadata.

examples.code: file.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: setMetadata
methods.description:
Merge the given metadata with the current remote file's metadata. This will set metadata if it was previously unset or update previously set metadata. To unset previously set metadata, set its value to null.

You can set custom key/value pairs in the metadata key of the given object, however the other properties outside of this object must adhere to the official API documentation.

See the examples below for more information.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: acl
methods.description:
Cloud Storage uses access control lists (ACLs) to manage object and bucket access. ACLs are the mechanism you use to share objects with other users and allow other users to access your buckets and objects.

An ACL consists of one or more entries, where each entry grants permissions to an entity. Permissions define the actions that can be performed against an object or bucket (for example, READ or WRITE); the entity defines who the permission applies to (for example, a specific user or group of users).

The acl object on a File instance provides methods to get you a list of the ACLs defined on your bucket, as well as set, update, and delete them.

examples.caption: Make a file publicly readable.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Copy this file to another file. By default, this will copy the file to the same bucket, but you can choose to copy it to another Bucket by providing a Bucket or File object or a URL starting with "gs://".

examples.caption: You can pass in a variety of types for the destination. For all of the below examples, assume we are working with the following Bucket and File objects.
examples.code:
var bucket = gcs.bucket('my-bucket');
var file = bucket.file('my-image.png');

examples.caption: If you pass in a string for the destination, the file is copied to its current bucket, under the new name provided.
If you pass in a string starting with "gs: " for the destination, the file is copied to the other bucket and under the new name provided.
If you pass in a Bucket object, the file will be copied to that bucket using the same name.
If you pass in a File object, you have complete control over the new bucket and filename.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

exceptions.description: If the destination file is not provided.

methods.name: createReadStream
methods.description:
Create a readable stream to read the contents of the remote file. It can be piped to a writable stream or listened to for 'data' events to read a file's contents.

In the unlikely event there is a mismatch between what you downloaded and the version in your Bucket, your error handler will receive an error with code "CONTENT_DOWNLOAD_MISMATCH". If you receive this error, the best recourse is to try downloading the file again.

For faster crc32c computation, you must manually install fast-crc32c:

$ npm install --save fast-crc32c

NOTE: Readable streams will emit the end event when the file is fully downloaded.

examples.caption:
Downloading a File

The example below demonstrates how we can reference a remote file, then pipe its contents to a local file. This is effectively creating a local backup of your remote data.
To limit the downloaded data to only a byte range, pass an options object.
To read a tail byte range, specify only options.end as a negative number.

params.name: options.validation
params.description: • Possible values: "md5", "crc32c", or false. By default, data integrity is validated with a CRC32c checksum. You may use MD5 if preferred, but that hash is not supported for composite objects. An error will be raised if MD5 is specified but is not available. You may also choose to skip validation completely, however this is not recommended.

params.name: options.start
params.description: • A byte offset to begin the file's download from. Default is 0. NOTE: Byte ranges are inclusive; that is, options.start = 0 and options.end = 999 represent the first 1000 bytes in a file or object. NOTE: when specifying a byte range, data integrity is not available.

params.name: options.end
params.description: • A byte offset to stop reading the file at. NOTE: Byte ranges are inclusive; that is, options.start = 0 and options.end = 999 represent the first 1000 bytes in a file or object. NOTE: when specifying a byte range, data integrity is not available.

methods.name: createResumableUpload
methods.description:
Create a unique resumable upload session URI. This is the first step when performing a resumable upload.

See the Resumable upload guide for more on how the entire process works.

Note

If you are just looking to perform a resumable upload without worrying about any of the details, see storage/createWriteStream. Resumable uploads are performed by default.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.origin
params.description: • Origin header to set for the upload.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description:
• Apply a predefined set of access controls to this object.

    Acceptable values are:

    • authenticatedRead - Object owner gets OWNER access, and allAuthenticatedUsers get READER access.

    • bucketOwnerFullControl - Object owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get OWNER access.

    • bucketOwnerRead - Object owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get READER access.

    • private - Object owner gets OWNER access.

    • projectPrivate - Object owner gets OWNER access, and project team members get access according to their roles.

    • publicRead - Object owner gets OWNER access, and allUsers get READER access.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: createWriteStream
methods.description:
Create a writable stream to overwrite the contents of the file in your bucket.

A File object can also be used to create files for the first time.

Resumable uploads are automatically enabled and must be shut off explicitly by setting options.resumable to false.

There is some overhead when using a resumable upload that can cause noticeable performance degradation while uploading a series of small files. When uploading files less than 10MB, it is recommended that the resumable feature is disabled.

For faster crc32c computation, you must manually install fast-crc32c:

$ npm install --save fast-crc32c

NOTE: Writable streams will emit the finish event when the file is fully uploaded.

examples.code: var fs = require('fs');

examples.caption:
Uploading a File

Now, consider a case where we want to upload a file to your bucket. You have the option of using storage/bucket#upload, but that is just a convenience method which will do the following.
Uploading a File with gzip compression
Downloading the file with createReadStream will automatically decode the file.

Uploading a File with Metadata

One last case you may run into is when you want to upload a file to your bucket and set its metadata at the same time. Like above, you can use storage/bucket#upload to do this, which is just a wrapper around the following.

params.name: options.gzip
params.description: • Automatically gzip the file. This will set options.metadata.contentEncoding to gzip.

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: • See the examples below or Objects: insert request body for more details.

params.name: options.offset
params.description: • The starting byte of the upload stream, for resuming an interrupted upload. Defaults to 0.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description:
• Apply a predefined set of access controls to this object.

    Acceptable values are:

    • authenticatedRead - Object owner gets OWNER access, and allAuthenticatedUsers get READER access.

    • bucketOwnerFullControl - Object owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get OWNER access.

    • bucketOwnerRead - Object owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get READER access.

    • private - Object owner gets OWNER access.

    • projectPrivate - Object owner gets OWNER access, and project team members get access according to their roles.

    • publicRead - Object owner gets OWNER access, and allUsers get READER access.

params.name: options.resumable
params.description: • Force a resumable upload. NOTE: When working with streams, the file format and size is unknown until it's completely consumed. Because of this, it's best for you to be explicit for what makes sense given your input.

params.name: options.uri
params.description: • The URI for an already-created resumable upload. See storage/file#createResumableUpload.

params.name: options.validation
params.description: • Possible values: "md5", "crc32c", or false. By default, data integrity is validated with a CRC32c checksum. You may use MD5 if preferred, but that hash is not supported for composite objects. An error will be raised if MD5 is specified but is not available. You may also choose to skip validation completely, however this is not recommended.

methods.name: download
methods.description: Convenience method to download a file into memory or to a local destination.

examples.caption: Download a file into memory. The contents will be available as the second argument in the demonstration below, contents.
examples.code: file.download(function(err, contents) {});

examples.caption: Download a file to a local destination.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options
params.description: • Optional configuration. The arguments match those passed to storage/file#createReadStream.

params.name: options.destination
params.description: • Local file path to write the file's contents to.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: setEncryptionKey
methods.description: The Storage API allows you to use a custom key for server-side encryption.

methods.name: getSignedPolicy
methods.description: Get a signed policy document to allow a user to upload data with a POST request.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.equals
params.description: • Array of request parameters and their expected value (e.g. [['$', '']]). Values are translated into equality constraints in the conditions field of the policy document (e.g. ['eq', '$', '']). If only one equality condition is to be specified, options.equals can be a one- dimensional array (e.g. ['$', '']).

params.name: options.expires
params.description: • A timestamp when this policy will expire. Any value given is passed to new Date().

params.name: options.startsWith
params.description: • Array of request parameters and their expected prefixes (e.g. [['$', '']). Values are translated into starts-with constraints in the conditions field of the policy document (e.g. ['starts-with', '$', '']). If only one prefix condition is to be specified, options.startsWith can be a one- dimensional array (e.g. ['$', '']).

params.name: options.acl
params.description: • ACL for the object from possibly predefined ACLs.

params.name: options.successRedirect
params.description: • The URL to which the user client is redirected if the upload is successful.

params.name: options.successStatus
params.description: • The status of the Google Storage response if the upload is successful (must be string).

params.name: options.contentLengthRange.min
params.description: • Minimum value for the request's content length.

params.name: options.contentLengthRange.max
params.description: • Maximum value for the request's content length.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

exceptions.description: If an expiration timestamp from the past is given.
If options.equals has an array with less or more than two members.
If options.startsWith has an array with less or more than two members.

methods.name: getSignedUrl
methods.description: Get a signed URL to allow limited time access to the file.

examples.caption: Generate a URL that allows temporary access to download your file.
Generate a URL to allow write permissions. This means anyone with this URL can send a POST request with new data that will overwrite the file.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: config.contentMd5
params.description: • The MD5 digest value in base64. If you provide this, the client must provide this HTTP header with this same value in its request.

params.name: config.contentType
params.description: • If you provide this value, the client must provide this HTTP header set to the same value.

params.name: config.expires
params.description: • A timestamp when this link will expire. Any value given is passed to new Date().

params.name: config.extensionHeaders
params.description: • If these headers are used, the server will check to make sure that the client provides matching values.

params.name: config.promptSaveAs
params.description: • The filename to prompt the user to save the file as when the signed url is accessed. This is ignored if config.responseDisposition is set.

params.name: config.responseType
params.description: • The response-content-type parameter of the signed url.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

exceptions.description: if an expiration timestamp from the past is given.

methods.name: makePrivate
methods.description: Make a file private to the project and remove all other permissions. Set options.strict to true to make the file private to only the owner.

examples.caption: Set the file private so only project maintainers can see and modify it.
examples.code: file.makePrivate(function(err) {});

examples.caption: Set the file private so only the owner can see and modify it.
examples.code: file.makePrivate({ strict: true }, function(err) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.strict
params.description: • If true, set the file to be private to only the owner user. Otherwise, it will be private to the project.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: makePublic
methods.description: Set a file to be publicly readable and maintain all previous permissions.

examples.code: file.makePublic(function(err, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: move
methods.description:
Move this file to another location. By default, this will move the file to the same bucket, but you can choose to move it to another Bucket by providing a Bucket or File object or a URL beginning with "gs://".

Warning: There is currently no atomic move method in the Cloud Storage API, so this method is a composition of storage/file#copy (to the new location) and storage/file#delete (from the old location). While unlikely, it is possible that an error returned to your callback could be triggered from either one of these API calls failing, which could leave a duplicate file lingering.

examples.caption: You can pass in a variety of types for the destination. For all of the below examples, assume we are working with the following Bucket and File objects.
examples.code:
var bucket = gcs.bucket('my-bucket');
var file = bucket.file('my-image.png');

examples.caption: If you pass in a string for the destination, the file is moved to its current bucket, under the new name provided.
If you pass in a string starting with "gs: " for the destination, the file is copied to the other bucket and under the new name provided.
If you pass in a Bucket object, the file will be moved to that bucket using the same name.
If you pass in a File object, you have complete control over the new bucket and filename.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

exceptions.description: If the destination file is not provided.

methods.name: save
methods.description:
Write arbitrary data to a file.

This is a convenience method which wraps storage/file#createWriteStream.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.
examples.code: file.save(contents).then(function() {});

params.name: data
params.description: • The data to write to a file.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: setStorageClass
methods.description: Set the storage class for this file.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.
examples.code: file.setStorageClass('regional').then(function() {});

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: acl.owners
methods.description:
An object of convenience methods to add or delete owner ACL permissions for a given entity.

The supported methods include:

  • myFile.acl.owners.addAllAuthenticatedUsers
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteAllAuthenticatedUsers
  • myFile.acl.owners.addAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.owners.addDomain
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteDomain
  • myFile.acl.owners.addGroup
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteGroup
  • myFile.acl.owners.addProject
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteProject
  • myFile.acl.owners.addUser
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteUser

examples.caption: Add a user as an owner of a file.
For reference, the above command is the same as running the following.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

methods.name: acl.readers
methods.description:
An object of convenience methods to add or delete reader ACL permissions for a given entity.

The supported methods include:

  • myFile.acl.readers.addAllAuthenticatedUsers
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteAllAuthenticatedUsers
  • myFile.acl.readers.addAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.readers.addDomain
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteDomain
  • myFile.acl.readers.addGroup
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteGroup
  • myFile.acl.readers.addProject
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteProject
  • myFile.acl.readers.addUser
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteUser

examples.caption: Add a user as a reader of a file.
examples.code: myFile.acl.readers.addUser('email@example.com', function(err, aclObject) {});

examples.caption: For reference, the above command is the same as running the following.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

methods.name: acl.writers
methods.description:
An object of convenience methods to add or delete writer ACL permissions for a given entity.

The supported methods include:

  • myFile.acl.writers.addAllAuthenticatedUsers
  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteAllAuthenticatedUsers
  • myFile.acl.writers.addAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.writers.addDomain
  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteDomain
  • myFile.acl.writers.addGroup
  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteGroup
  • myFile.acl.writers.addProject
  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteProject
  • myFile.acl.writers.addUser
  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteUser

examples.caption: Add a user as a writer of a file.
examples.code: myFile.acl.writers.addUser('email@example.com', function(err, aclObject) {});

examples.caption: For reference, the above command is the same as running the following.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

methods.name: acl.add
methods.description: Add access controls on a storage/bucket or storage/file.

examples.caption: For file ACL operations, you can also specify a generation property. Here is how you would grant ownership permissions to a user on a specific revision of a file.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.role
params.description: • Permissions allowed for the defined entity. See storage#acl.

params.name: options.generation
params.description: • File Objects Only Select a specific revision of this file (as opposed to the latest version, the default).

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: acl.delete
methods.description: Delete access controls on a storage/bucket or storage/file.

examples.caption: For file ACL operations, you can also specify a generation property.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.generation
params.description: • File Objects Only Select a specific revision of this file (as opposed to the latest version, the default).

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: acl.get
methods.description: Get access controls on a storage/bucket or storage/file. If an entity is omitted, you will receive an array of all applicable access controls.

examples.caption: Get all access controls.
For file ACL operations, you can also specify a generation property.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object. If you want to receive a list of all access controls, pass the callback function as the only argument.

params.name: options.generation
params.description: • File Objects Only Select a specific revision of this file (as opposed to the latest version, the default).

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: acl.update
methods.description: Update access controls on a storage/bucket or storage/file.

examples.caption: For file ACL operations, you can also specify a generation property.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.role
params.description: • Permissions allowed for the defined entity. See storage#acl.

params.name: options.generation
params.description: • File Objects Only Select a specific revision of this file (as opposed to the latest version, the default).

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request
